The pictures were a bit deceiving when I was trying to guess how the material would feel but I can say my expectations were surpassed.Hopefully this helps out fellow brothers my size. I know this is the type of review I would try to scour for before purchasing, but with little success.

The perfect fit, the perfect fabric, the perfect selection. We got them in every color and we don't regret it. If you've got a long torso and a particular need for softness, this is the shirt for you. The neon green/yellow is great for public events with a crowd.

So far I’ve purchased six different kinds of white T-shirts and this one is the most soft.It is kind of see-through which is what I’m trying to avoid, hence why I’d buy six different kinds of white T-shirts, but it is probably the best out of all of them.It’s probably the least see-through out of all of them.It seems to be good quality, too.So if you’re reading these reviews looking for softness, get it.If you’re looking for a 100% non see-through white shirt, this isn’t exactly the one but try it if you want. I’d say it’s worth it for how soft it is.

I'm 5'7", have a muscular build, weigh about 168lbs. This shirt is very soft and it didn't overtly shrink in the wash/dryer. It's a great fit. I plan to buy more now that I know the cut is nice. The sleeves aren't too long and there's plenty of room in the chest and lat areas so you don't feel constricted but it's still form fitting. Awesome shirts.
This isn't just an underwear, u can wear it as a t,shirt to party,great quality low price is the best definition for it i love.abt to get four more in different colors

As other reviewers mentioned, absolutely wonderful t-shirts.  No logos, no BS, super comfy, stylish.  I'm 6'2, 270lbs, I work out but not crazy.  I bought the 3XL size.  I bought one, got it, tried it on, and went back immediately and bought 10 more in different colors.I wear them all the time, casual with jeans, dress up with slacks, although I find their colors don't really suit active wear.  I mean, they are comfortable but look a bit out of place for active wear.  Maybe because they are just plain shirts, no logos or anything, and active wear I guess is suppose to be moving billboards...but yes, I wear them at the gym because I really don't care and they are just so super soft comfy.

One of the best fitting t-shirts ever worn, this is without a wash, hopefully it doesn't shrink. I'm 5'11", 175 lbs and a large fits well, but maybe just a tad too long. The sleeve length and tightness is spot on and the body section tapers down toward the waist. If you like the original plain volcom t-shirts you'll probably also like this fit and material, they are both about the same weight only $10 cheaper. If you have a thin triangular torso shape, and have a hard time finding shirts to fit because most U.S. shirts are designed to fit people over weight, then this shirt is for you. Not too tight, not too loose, just about perfect.

These are pretty great t-shirts! I’ve been on the hunt for a nice, slim fitting t, that more than anything, fits snugly around the chest and biceps of my skinny 5’10 150 lbs frame. Lots of brands have met me down, being too small on me in small but too big on me in medium, but due to Reddit reviews, I decided to give a medium Next Level a try.I read through hundreds and hundreds of reviews, but one thing not a single one has mentioned are the actual measurements of their shirts.I ordered the black CVC. New and unwashed, laying flat on a flat surface after wearing for a couple hours, the medium measures around 6.75 inches in the bicep opening, 20.5 inches pit to pit, has a sleeve length of 9 inches and a length of 29 in the front and 29.3 in the back. So honestly, slimmer than most brands, but not as slim as I had hoped and too baggy every which way.However, after washing for 45 mins on warm, and drying for roughly 40 mins on warm (so the middle setting), the shirt ended up measuring 6.25 inches in the bicep, 19.5 pit to pit, has a sleeve length of 8.4 inches and a length of 28.5 front and back.Ultimately, this is just about perfect for me, and I have ordered several more. I love this t shirt so much right now. I just wanted to put these measurements out there because I realize every body is different.
i love the fit, i wore this to work as a dress shirt, i'm a female 180 lbs and a small fits just right

The shirt size, fit, color etc. are fine, but the product description is incorrect. It's listed on Amazon in the description as 100% cotton, which it is not. The tag on the shirt (Charcoal, Medium) says 65% polyester, 35% cotton. Just so you know.

I love the rich color, fit, and style of these; already have 3 other colors of same shirt. Can be worn in or out. And I never dry in dryer but for 10 minutes to get mostly dry, then I hanger the rest. Doing this with all shirts like this minimizes ironing and shrinkage over the life of the piece (dryers kill clothes). I marked "fits as expected" but that's only because I now expect all clothing to fit differently than what sizes once indicated. I'm the same weight & measurement as I was 2 decades ago (5-9, 185); however, I now sometimes have to buy extra large rather than just large. Clothes are now made all over the world; that has to create sizing problems.

After my two original shirts that I bought just before starting my job in finance services were getting so worn out in some places that you could see the light shine right through them if you held it up to a lamp or otherwise, I knew it was time to replace them.  Since I had great satisfaction from Dickies products before, I thought I would give it a try and buy two of these awesome shirts to wear to work.In all honesty, I really could not have made a better choice than to get two of these.  Not only do they look good, but they FEEL good as well!  Hunter Green and Navy Blue are two of the best colors for my liking.  Additionally, I can also guess that these will likely last a lot longer than the two shirts I had originally, seeing as these are made with thicker material and are seemingly FAR sturdier.  I will definitely buy more Dickies clothes down the road.

Candidate for plumbers crack, I own dozens of Dickies work shirts, all had been purchased at Walmart and the price kept getting higher and higher. Found these on Amazon and ordered 3, luckily I only ordered 3 since I am highly disappointed in the quality and fit of these shirts. I wonder if these are bootleg products? The color fades very quickly, I have old Dickies shirts that have more color than these do and these have only been washed maybe a dozen times. The biggest problem I have is the tails of these shirts are shorter than the ones I buy at Walmart, I spend a lot of time bending, stretching and kneeling at work and I am constantly tucking the tail of these shirts back in, they are a good 1 to 2 inches shorter than the Dickies I buy at Walmart. The Walmart shirts rarely have to be tucked back in but with these it is constant and never ending, it is to the point I don't even want to wear these shirts to work, brand new shirts that I will only wear to mow the grass or lounge around the house what a waste of money, I will not be buying more of these shirts from Amazon.

Carhartt wins hands down. I haven't purchased one of these Dickie's shirts in years and I was somewhat disappointed at the quality of the fabric. The fabric is thinner than I remember and it itches without an undershirt on. The Carhartt shirts on the other hand are a lot thicker and I prefer the way the buttons are placed....with Dickies there is an odd distance between the top button and the next to last button. However Dickies has Carhartt beat on colors hands down. I needed a dark brown work shirt and this was the only one available that I liked. If you live in a warmer climate these will be fine but don't expect a heavy duty work shirt. You will still get a decent shirt and the style is classic.....but it is a little different than what the Dickies shirts I wore in the 80's. Fit is good if not a little "loose". Order you regular Dickies sizing. I am an XL at 5'10" 220 lbs.

I'd say this item fits a little large - except that that's exactly how it should. The fabric is unstretchy, and I feel will surely last years and years, as it feels so durable. It's not uncomfortable, but it's not cotton, either, and you shouldn't expect to be reaching for these for a day of lounging on the couch after busting ass all month, wearing them.I presume they'll take wear very well, but they're not exactly super comfortable.

Excellent shirts, very comfortable, and made very well, but the sizing is pretty far off. I typically fit a 2XL in most brands very well, so that's what I ordered for these. Unfortunately, despite being my normal size, I swim in them. They're absolutely massive. It almost seems like a set of 3x or 4x shirts got the wrong tags. Having said that, I ordered this model shirt two each in three different colors, and the fit for all 6 was identical, so apparently it's just how they're made. They're made well and very comfortable, so I'd definitely recommend them, but make sure you go down a size or two from your normal.

Perfect shirt for a summer wedding.  Dressy-ish, without being too formal.  Because it's a durable work shirt, it was a little stiff, but after washing with a lot of fabric softener, it feels much better.

I bought several work shirts in different colors since they were on sale. The dark brown one I received came in plastic packaging without the standard cardboard dickies labels that you typically get with these shirts. I didn't think much of it until I started to inspect the shirt. The brand tag on the back of the neck is different than regular shirts I have purchased. I don't want to make false claims but it doesn't seem like a regular dickies work shirt. Other ones I have purchased show sizing using a letter indicating whether it's small, large or so on. This particular tag uses a numerical size rating. This shirt also came with a missing button hole for the bottom button. On these shirts, there should be a dickies tag on the bottom of the shirt near the last button and this shirt did not have that. I also lined up this shirt alongside the other dickies work shirt to notice any other differences regarding construction. This shirt doesn't seem to line up the same with the stitchings as if the pattern for the material cutouts they used for the individual pattern pieces are different for this particular shirt. I can also notice that the stitching and spacing for the pen hole in the pocket are different than the other ones I have. Overall I am disappointed in this purchase and will probably order directly from dickies next time.

I had read reviews to size up, so that is what I did and I am glad I did. I normally wear a L and ordered and XL. It isnt a womens fit shirt so the sleeves are longer than i would have liked. the shirt is thicker than a normal cotton shirt and I feel like it would shrink after the first wash making it too short. I would of liked it to be a tad bit longer. but overall not a bad shirt.
Washed a few times and lettering hasn't faded, it's a tighter fit and I sized up- sleeves are not folded

I don't know how to properly explain this but this whole shirt felt awkward, but It also technically fit. It fell to my hips (i'm 5'3 135bls) and wasn't baggy or tight. I couldn't leave it on for more than 2 mins without being completely agitated. The sleeves fell at a really weird place on my arms. It's a v neck and in my (probably a bit conservative) opinion, is cut a little too deep. The print was really the problem. It was too low on the shirt. It sort of sat toward the mid stomach area. I intended to wear this with a maxi skirt, but I could only see "Be" because "kind" was completely covered by the skirt. The material of the shirt and the yellow color was alright though.
Loved this shirt! The fabric is pretty stretchy, so it’s supee comfy! Totally recomend this and lots of people ask where I get it from!
Perfect fit ,comfortable shirt.
Wore it for when I went to Halloween Horror Nights. Everyone loved the shirt. I got a Large, runs really loose so you can go one size smaller if you want.
Really cute design!!. I liked the design a lot! It was an AMAZING SHIRT!! But the shirt ripped and shank after washed.
Fits perfect, love it!

Cute shirt with a great message! I ordered a size medium since I wanted a bit of a looser fit, and I like how it fits. Shirt material is pretty standard T-shirt feel. I’m looking forward to many wears.

It seems so hard to find V-neck shirts so I was happy to see this was offered in V-neck. When I was picking this out I wasn't sure what shade of yellow to expect. It seemed like it could be a bright sun yellow but was more of a golden yellow. I actually love the golden yellow look. It is bright but not to bright. It allows the text on the shirt to be read easier. May pick up a few more with different quotes.

DO NOT BUY THESE SHOES! These are definitely not real TOMS. I have had several pairs of Toms in the past and they always fit wonderfully and feel really well made. These shoes, on the other hand, feel very cheap and smell absolutely horrible when you take them out of the box. The fabric is wrong, the sole of the shoe is way more narrow than real TOMS, and the insole is cheap.I am seriously considering not shopping on Amazon anymore because there are so many fakes.

They were OK except I'm not buying Toms on amazon anymore, they're sized totally inconsistently and i wonder if they're a knock off or actual Toms.  You have to expect to order a pair of your size and see what you get, they could be too small or big from what the reviews are saying.  Mine were too small, not only in length, but the top of the shoe was really tight.  I read where some people said to remove the memory foam from inside and they would fit better.  I tried it and they did, but then they weren't comfortable, they need the foam on the bottom!  If I purchase again, it will be somewhere I can try them on without the hassle of returns.

I wore these 2 or 3 times over the summer last year. I was all excited to wear them again this year. They were kept in the original box the whole time. I took them out of the box and they yellowed horribly. They are almost cream now. I spent a lot of money on these and couldnt be more disappointed. I bought them to wear with a pair of white jeans and now they look horrible with them and of course now it's too late to return or even exchange them.  Very,  very sad and disappointed. I really liked them but now they look terrible.
I don’t feel this is a Ginuwine Tom product. The soul was glued. This song was not very comfortable and it didn’t quite fit well I ordered a size 6 and it was too loose. So I returned them

I wore them on my wedding day and was so happy! They are inexpensive (compared to other wedding shoes), great for outside, and do not add a ton of height! I did spend about a week before the wedding breaking them in, but I was so happy and comfortable, during my wedding. I do recommend wearing small socks (like Keds socks or socks for flats) as my feet did sweat a lot with all the layers of tulle and the summer heat! Overall I was really pleased and thankful I picked such comfortable shoes!

I've always been told how comfy these shoes are, so finally I've tried them. I do really like them. The size I ordered this time, is a little small, but that's my fault. I can wear an 8 or an 8 1/2, I just usually go by how they feel when I try them on. I wasn't sure with the Tom's, since I hadn't even tried them on before, so I ended up going with an 8. They actually fit fine and they're already stretching a bit from wearing them, but I think I will definitely go with the 8 1/2 next time.The shoe is great! I'm happy with my purchase. It was a learning experience,  but I knew it would be, when I ordered themThey definitely seem to be true to size.

So I love these shoes and I tried one on before vacation and it felt very comfortable and true to size. When I ultimately wore both of them yesterday I realized that the right shoe has a defective seam that's sewn twice as thick on the top right of the shoe, and which causes great pain. I'm not sure what to do since now I have no shoes to wear on my vacation. Very poor quality control.

I love these shoes, and what the company does. However, this was my second pair and I wasn't so much impressed. The very first day I wore them the inside sole completely detached and came out. My old toms I wore for probably a year and nothing like that happened. I only replaced them because they are dirty. Dissappointed. They are still very comfy and stylish.

I wanted to love these but they were so tight across my foot I couldn’t stand to wear them for more then 30 min. I wore them around the house to see how they fit and within 30 min I had a blister on my second to last toe and a red mark across the whole top of my foot. The length was good, in fact I still had a 1/4 inch of room so I don’t understand why they were so tight. I’ve owned two other pairs in the past 6 years so I wonder if the design has changed.

This is my third pair of TOM's canvas slip-on shoes. I love the look and feel. I do wear small Dr. Scholl's insoles to give a little bit of arch support. The bottoms are a bit slippery, but in general I plan on buying at least one more pair of these - I have the ash and navy colors and want to add red! They're delightful and, with each purchase, TOM's donates a free pair of shoes to a needy child. What's not to love?
Fits great for plus size women. I am usually a xxl and i ordered a 3x it is roomy and plenty of room if it shrinks in the dryer. I love the style and fit!!!Surprised that its so roomy.

I bought this as a gift for my aunt who absolutely LOVES Game of Thrones (and I can't blame her...haha). She loved the gift and when I got it in the mail I did note that it is good quality. If you know someone who loves Game of Thrones or if you do, this is a worth-it buy!

The design, the fit, the quality, and ofcourse the design is sooooo good!!! I'm a die hard GOT fan and have bought MANY shirts from this company and they have never disappointed me!! I highly recommend them!!
Bought this for my GF as she loves GOT and gets a kick out of The Mother of Dragons.  Fit was true to size and material is not cheap at all.
True US sizing
Fit perfectly for the size ordered. I've washed several times and it hasn't shrunk or faded. Id definitely order from the company again.

I loved the red color of this shirt and the fact that it was a a v-neck, as I have a very short neck; but it was really small.  I wear an XL for all my tops (or an 18/20).  I ordered a size up to XXL, so I was surprised that this was as small as it was -- more like a large. (My sister wears a medium, and it was just a little too big for her).  The fabric was a little thin for my taste as well.  I would have definitely needed a  camisole underneath the shirt.  But that is a personal preference for someone of more advanced age.  I'm sure it would have been a perfect thickness for most.  I'm returning it.  But I did love the color and the style
Looks like the photos but the material is really thin. Also runs pretty big
Bought this for a secret Santa gift and she loves it. She doesn't like normal shirts and this seemed perfect for a targaryen. Jk
My daughter is a huge thrones fan and she loved this shirt.It has a nice weight to it .My daughter usually wears a small or medium and I got her a medium and she could wear it over another top.

I'm about 5'3" and 133lbs. I ordered three packs of these shirts in various colors, all in small. If you're looking for a looser fit, I agree you'd want to order a size up. However, I wanted to wear these under tee-shirts during slightly cooler weather. I usually wear size small, and these shirts fit exactly the way I want them to. They're a bit snug in the sleeves (but not bad at all), and the fit of the body of the shirt is perfect. I love the scoop neck so I don't have to try to line up the collar with the other shirt I'm wearing. The length is also great, so there's more color sticking out from under my tee-shirt. The price worked out to about $6 per shirt, which is AMAZING. (I purchased three 3-packs at $18 each.) The material of the shirts is somewhat thin, so I definitely don't recommend wearing the white shirt on its own. You could get away with wearing the darker colors on their own though. And that's another thing, the color variety in these shirts is great. I'll definitely come back for more in a year when the weather cools back off!

I've seen the words "runs small" in plenty of reviews, and I have always disagreed when I've tried on the garment for myself. HOWEVER, these tops actually do run small. I'm 5'5", 115 lbs, 32C, 26" waist, 34" hip. I ordered a small and it is definitely a slim cut top. Even on my small frame I found It to be clingy (but a perfect base layer). I like the top enough to order it again in a size medium for a more relaxed fit.

I'm 5' 6", 125 lbs, chest 36" (34C bra), waist 27" and I ordered these in size medium. They're fitted nicely without being super tight and uncomfortable, they're great for layering int he spring and fall and I often wear them to lounge around on days off as well. I have them in many colours, and while the fabric is thin, it's soft and holds up nicely if you care for it properly.

My new favorite long sleeve shirt!! Being petite at 5'1" it is always a challenge to find shirts that fit it the shoulders and don't have sleeves down to my knees. This super soft top fits perfectly and the length is also perfect and arrived right on time and the color was true to the picture. Highly recommend for smaller women!!

Way too small.  I typically wear a small or medium.  There is no free return, so by the time you pay shipping to return for a refund, you've paid more than the original purchase. I'm going to donate it.

I purchased a medium. I am 5,6 and 143lbs. Athletic.I purchased a set of 3. Spending the little I did on these I assumed they may not fit right, but they are perfect! The only complaint I have is that the scoop around the neck wrinkles up and doesn’t stay flat. I will more than likely be buying more of these in more colors!

S in royal fits me (usually junior S or petite XS). I like that it's not super long like most tops cuz I am short and have a hard time finding tops that aren't super long. The sleeves are long but that's ok. The color is on point and the fabric is comfortable. I order two more and hope those two will fit just like this one.Update: I just washed it and dried it in the dryer. I was hoping it would shrink a bit to fit more snugly and become just a tad shorter - it did. Now it fits perfectly but I wouldn't dry it in the dryer ever again. So if you don't want yours to shrink, don't use the dryer.

Fit is a tad small for me and I am normally a small to an extra small.  I am 5'7" and weight 118 lbs, athletic body type.  So very little room to wiggle.  They were tight on me, however they did not rip in the armpits, sleeves were plenty long so I am satisfied, and would buy them again. Great amount of elastic also.  I have been wearing them under scrubs and I don't have too much of a problem with them being too warm.  I don't know how they would fit if you have a larger belly or breast size.

I bought this for layering. I wear a lot of cute flowy vests, and these are perfect. They do run snug, I normally wear an XL, but I'm glad after reading reviews I bought the XXL. The XXL fits pretty snug so it can't be worn alone. I have 2 more arriving today that are an XXXL I expect they will fit a little looser so they can be worn alone. Over all thoug, these tops are exactly what I was looking for. I am SO happy with the purchase.

I was so excited with anticipation for these package of 3 beautiful cotton T-shirt Tees but was greatly disappointed. The problem was not the fabric, size or description of the product but more important what was not described, a kind of label. Every Tee included a horrible label. This very nice soft cotton T-shirt Tee fabric was sewn on to a course edged label with very fine monofilament fishing line. One could barely see the thread with a magnifying lamp but could definitely be felt as it scratched and poked my neck and back. Each of 3 Tee's had to be carefully taken off without damaging the fabric. Only 1 of the 3 survived unscathed -- the other 2 have very small holes from the punctures of the needles. I would loved to buy more of them but the time, effort and result is not worth it.

I love this top. The fabric is light and has great stretch for a nice, snug fit. Love it!**I’m 5’7, 145 lbs and would normally order a medium for a fitted garment. I bought a large and it’s perfect.**

Pretty surprised at the quality of this top, I honesly wasn’t expecting much from it. It has a nice texture to it (it’s sort of velvety), fits good (usually order a small but got a medium incase it ran small) and love the pattern (sometimes leopard print can look cheap). The only qualm I have is that the turtleneck isn’t as tight as I would like it to be. Maybe if I had ordered a small it wouldn’t fit better. To fix this issue, I just used a small bobby pin and affixed it to the back to tighten it closes to my neck. Great buy, thinking about getting more in the other colors and maybe in a smaller size too.

this top is perfect for layering or worn by itself. you can't beat this top for the price and it's so soft - i love rayon and with the 5% spandex it hugs your body gently. i am 5'5" and weigh 115 with a 34" bust and normally order a small, which is what i ordered and it fit perfectly; in fact, i ordered three more in various colors. seller delivered on time and i would recommend both the seller and the top to my friends and family!
bought XL...5'5" 140 lbs...looks great...you can dress it up or down...light, thin, cool, comfortable material...the Large would have been more fitted on me, but I prefer the way the XL fits for me

It's a great shirt that meets the size chart measurements. I was skeptical, but it fit perfectly, and the quality of the fabric is better than what you'd expect for a shirt that is less than $20. I would buy it again in different colors.

I purchased this item in both white and black, size XL. For reference, I am 5'6, ~180 pounds, 36-38-46.The items arrived quickly, and in good condition. I am very pleased with the fit, cut, and style of the black top, and will be keeping it.I am returning the white one, however, because it is sheer and not nearly opaque enough to be office appropriate (a struggle I have come across time after time trying to find white tops).
I love this top. I got a small - it fits great. Not too clingy, but not baggy either. I will definitely be buying multiple colors.

The fabric is thin and soft, but not to a point when it is almost transparent, so it works perfectly for summer on its own or under layers during rest of seasons. I'm happy with both the cut and fabric. The service is very good, quickly delivered - earlier than expected, with a thank you note and surprise gift. Ordered more than one. More than happy with this product and seller!

I really like these turtlenecks, and I am not a turtleneck person. These are sleeveless so they are perfect to wear underneath my button up sweaters which I need to wear for my uniform for work. These were super soft and very comfortable to wear. I normally wear a size top 10 so I ordered an extra large to be on the safe side. It is perfect. The neck is not too tight, it fits very comfortably. There was even a bonus gift, a really pretty necklace. Highly recommend this seller!

beautiful fitI'm glad to purchase it, beautiful fit and great quality, the color was more vivid than in the picture. I got a compliment from my husband, really love this sleeveless shaping shirt tops.
Solid quality shirt, served my purpose perfectly
Good product. Great price.
love it
Fit well and as adverised.
comfortable

Last year, I bought a number of Under Armour clothing and since then, Under Armour has become my favorite workout clothing brand! I love the quality of the clothes, color selection, and how they are designed to keep you cool (or warm, depending on the line). I decided to get some more workout shirts this year and wanted to try some with a pattern rather than just the solid shirts, since I have some of those already. I didn't have any of the Twist Tech shirts and decided to give them a try.This Under Armour Twist Tech shirt is part of Under Armour's HeatGear line, which is designed to keep you cool in warm weather. This shirt is considered a LOOSE fit, which means you will most likely want to purchase a smaller size for a more comfortable fit. The shirt has a flattering V-neck cut and has a twisted, or heathered, pattern that makes it different than a solid color shirt. These shirts are made in Jordan of 100% polyester. Washing instructions say to wash with similar colors. I always put these in the washing machine on a normal cycle, hang them up to dry, and I've never had a problem with shrinking.I initially purchased one of these shirts to make sure I had the right size and loved it so much I ordered two more! For size reference, I am 5'6", 165 pounds, with a 36D chest and some extra belly fat from my twin pregnancy and I purchased a medium. I typically wear a medium or large in shirts and, since this shirt is a loose fit, I went with the medium and it fits perfectly! These shirts are so comfortable and I wear them a lot for working out. They keep me as cool and dry as possible (of course, I still sweat). They wash up well and I am also able to wear them for everyday wear with yoga pants. My mom is in her early 60s and wears these shirts for everyday wear, along with under her scrubs for work. She loves them as much as I do and wants to get some more! The fit is nice and comes down to the top of my rear, which is just how I like. I purchased the colors Pink Shock/Metallic Silver, Mediterranean/Metallic Silver, and Absinthe Green/Metallic Silver and I'm considering purchasing a couple more.I love these shirts and feel they are great for working out or for everyday wear. Please note, this shirt is a LOOSE fit so you will want to purchase a smaller size for a more flattering fit. I'd say if you have two sizes of shirts you normally wear, purchase the smaller size for this shirt. The shirt is nice enough to wear in public and I also purchased Under Armour Women's Armour Mid Sports Bra, Pink Shock/Rhino Gray, Large so I could color-coordinate with my shirts. I love these shirts and highly recommend them!

I'm 5'5" (168cm), 27.5' waist and ordered S. I was expecting semi-fitted but it happened to be a loose fit.As a loose fit, I chose the right size because it looks exactly like the model in the picture. Never snug around my waist.S is good for running but XS would have been better for weight training.(Size S width: chest 47cm, hem 51cm/ sleeve : 16cm/ length : 67cm)I learned that I should check the fit on the UA website before I buy.

I have four of these shirts and absolutely love them! They work great for all-day wear and hold up very well during my sweaty weightlifting sessions (1.5-2 hours long). My favorite feature of these shirts would have to be their ability to make you appear less sweaty than you actually are. As someone who does power lifting, Olympic lifting, and cardio in a non-air conditioned warehouse in the South, having a t-shirt that doesn't appear soaked in sweat, and doesn't showcase big armpit sweat stains (those are the worst), ten minutes into your workout, is a miracle. It also helps that these shirts are breathable and quick to dry. After each workout, I hand-wash the shirt with a little bit of soap, gently squeeze out the water from the shirt, put it on a hanger, and hang it from my shower head to dry - that way, I don't have to buy a week's worth of shirts or do the laundry every other day.Aside from functionality, the t-shirt, for me, fits as expected and per the size chart. I tend to prefer looser-fitting shirts and size medium, for my 34C-bra size, long torso - I'm 6 ft, and swimmer's shoulders (much broader than average), fits perfectly. I don't find these shirts to be transparent at all - I can wear a bright, different-colored sports bra underneath and it doesn't show through. The colors I have are vivid and bright as well (Cobalt, Water, Dynamo Blue, and Mega Magenta).I would definitely recommend Under Armour Women's Tech Twist V-Neck to anyone, especially those who participate in a sweat-prone activity or live in a hot, humid climate!

I'm 5'6 195 and ordered two of the XL. The fit is perfect and form fitting, not lose and not tight and that's how I wanted it. I just hope it doesn't shrink much. I'm normally an XL or XXL on Amazon. I read reviews so I knew it should fit me because it's a lose fit shirt so order a size down if you want it to be a form fit. My only complaint is that it shows my tummy bulge more then I would like. It's still flattering and cool/comfortable. I would like to get more in a larger size to have less tummy bulge and allow for shrinkage but they don't have an XXL.. It's still pretty flattering. The peach looks really pretty on me and shows my tan more.

I recently started running (been a bit over 2 months) and I purchase more and more appropriate clothing. I came across this one and really liked the look and the price so decided to try it out. I am about 165 Ibs (75 kg) and 5'2"(158 cm) and the medium size first me very well.The shirt is very lightweight and comfortable. It doesn’t take in much sweat and dries out fairly quickly, which is very handy with my hour long exercise sessions. I owe a gray one, and it is not transparent at all.I have had this shirt for a bit over 3 weeks, absolutely love it and workout with it almost every day. So far I have no complaints at all, but will update if I get any! Absolutely recommend!
Loose fit. I'm  usually a medium. I Need a small. Would have been fine if the description said loose fit. Product itself is 5 stars gave 4 because lack of info on description.

Just received today.  Very happy.  Ordered XL and typically wear a L or XL.  It is roomy but in a good way.  Definitely not too big.  Very nice material and feels like it will be good for hot and humid days.

This is my go-to T-shirt now for the gym. I love it. It's been washing up beautifully. I intentionally got it a little large so I would have full range of motion in my arms for working out. It's clearly a quality product; well constructed, excellent material.

This is a great athletic shirt. The material is silky soft and very flattering. I wish I had listened to the other reviews about the loose fit of this shirt. I normally wear a medium and wish I had ordered a small in this particular style. I’m keeping the medium because it’s fine but a small would have been better. Otherwise I’m verg pleased with this purchase.
Very see-through, but ok with a tank underneath. Otherwise very pretty.

I'm picky about shirts and I love this shirt! It's a great shirt to dress down or dress up! I wear it all the time! I'm ordering the Navy next. I'm a mom so I do have baby leftovers but it's very flattering and not too snug or baggy. I'm a 148lbs and 5'5" and I ordered the Large.

I bought the pink shirt. I thought it looked big at first but after trying it on it fits great.  It's very soft but on the thin side.  Not really cheap but you can't wear a patterned or color bra with it.  I also noticed my bra straps are visible due to the wide neck  line prior to washing and after I wore it for hours. Overall,  I like it. (Pictures are after washing in cold water,  no to little shrinkage)

This is a perfect basic shirt.  I'm 5'7" 160 slender build.  From the reviews I thought I should get a size or two up and I'm glad I did.  I typically wear a M in shirts but I got and XL.  It is Fitted at XL.

Nice material, although I found it to cling in an unflattering way. The shirt is soft, stretchy, and a bit heavy weight, but super thin if that makes sense. It is long, which I like, but it does no help hiding any lumps or bumps caused by my bra or jean waistband even with an undershirt. I wouldn't consider myself excessively lumpy, but it might work better with smooth bottoms (i.e. maxi skirt) or if you're super lean in the midsection. Perhaps non-white colors work better for this issue. For reference - I'm size 8 in women's clothing, I buy small/medium shirts normally in Women's (sometimes XS) and I bought the Medium white shirt.

Exactly what I was looking for! The fabric is super soft and feels like high quality. The scoop neck isn't too low, so I'll be able to wear this to work paired with a nice skirt. I bought this shirt in grey and am now planning to buy 3 more in the other colors! Very satisfied.

Needed a thin Black T-shirt to tuck into a pair of side zip pants. This is absolutely perfect. I’m 5’8, 125 lbs; 34D. Went with a medium and probably could have done a small, but didn’t want it skin tight so it was still professional for Friday casual. It’s perfect for layering or alone and will be ordering other colors.

Very comfortable and light business-casual t-shirt that goes great equally with a skirt, dress pants or jeans.  I ordered the navy blue one to go with a maxi skirt, and it is very comfortable and breathable, perfect for warmer weather and working in an office.  It is a little bit bigger than expected but not too much. If you're short or have a smaller frame, you may want to order a size down from your usual size.

All I can say is wow.  This shirt is fantastic - gorgeous colors, great cut, nice fabric, well made.  I own an ivory similar one by a name brand that cost about $100, and this one is nicer.  The only downside is I thought it would be easy to dye a white shirt a different color (as if there weren't enough choices), something I do often with modal fabric.  I failed to take into account the white thread, which does not dye at all, so the colored shirt has white stitching.  Bummer.  But with so many colors to choose from, that is a minor problem.  Highly recommend!
Very good quality tshirt. It's soft, a good length, and fits very well. I am 5'5, 158 lbs, bra size 38C and ordered a Large. It fits perfectly. Not too tight, but perfect!

I am still questing for the perfect simple fitted t-shirt. I normally wear a 12 or 14, and wear a L/XL in fitted women's tees. I took my measurements and compared them to the sizing chart provided. I fit solidly within the parameters for XXL (not at the limit of the size chart). I ordered 3, since there was a great color selection.The quality of the fabric is nice, the colors are lovely. The length is great, and even the sleeves aren't too short. The problem is the sizing. These run extremely small. While I can fit into them, they are skin tight, showing off every bit of my tummy. They look terrible over pants or jeans. I can't imagine these fitting someone at the higher range of the sizing chart. Perhaps if every fiber was stretched to the breaking point. . .I will keep them to wear tucked into a skirt, but that will be all I can do with them. Don't trust the size chart. Beware these shirts unless you want something to cling to your belly and hips like a second skin.

I LOVE this shirt!  It’s super flattering and comfy. The neckline is super cute. I liked it so well I wore it for a photo shoot. I ordered a large and I’m 5’5” 175 pounds. It is plenty big and lays nicely. I think I’ll order one in another color!

Pros:1. Super soft fabric2. True to size (large for 5,4”,142 lbs,34D)3. Did not shrink/lose whiteness after wash4. Pattern is flattering to my body shape5. Perfect for summerCons:1. I wish it was little shorter in lengthHit like if you like my review :)

I am not sure how I feel about this shirt yet. It does stick to your body and is very clingy. It is more of a form-fitting shirt than a flowy shirt. Not really what I was expecting. This shirt will show all of your flaws, which I am very self-conscious about.

This Aolakeke Cold Shoulder Blouse fit awesome. The material is very soft. Perfect to dress up or dress down. The cold shoulder and the criss cross neck detailing add a bit of fun and flirtiness.The material is so soft, breathable and lightweight it makes it perfect for travel. Great for packing in a suitcase or a duffle.The color was just as shown in picture. It also has nice stretch so even if you are a little bigger than the size you can fit it. It flows beautiful as well. I love the scallop detailing for the hem.Loving this top.

This shirt is advertised as primarily cotton - but it is not.  I'd be surprised if there's any cotton AT ALL in this product.  Very disappointed.  The label inside the garment says it's 95% cotton and 5% polyester but it is NOT.  I know the difference - NOT COTTON.  Which is why I wanted this shirt.  Cute design & color but I prefer all (or mostly) natural fibers.

I bought a large and that fell off me. Tried the medium, I wore it one day and the sleeves are very, kind of slippery. The shirt doesn’t stay put on your shoulders and the criss cross straps just fall  they don’t stay put either. I really like the shirt tho. Maybe I should have tried a small but I’m usually a medium or large.  It probably be better if you wear it alone, no sweater or jacket. Then it may stay put on you correctly. The model looks terrific but doesn’t look like that when you wear it.

Beautiful top! The fabric is very soft and hangs nicely~not too clingy. The army green color is vibrant but is not really army green. It looks like the picture, more of a hunter green.  I'm a 38DD and have a hard time finding tops that aren't tight at the top and this is perfect! I ordered XL.

Beautiful blue color and design. However, upon opening the package and trying it on, I noticed the right sleeve is stretched out of shape and the opening on the right shoulder of this shirt is bigger than the opening on the other sleeve, making the shirt look a little less refined. I don't like the way that looks. Thinking about sending it back to get another of the same shirt, hoping this won't be the case again. Ugh :(

Incredibly comfortable shirt! Color is actually quite close to the picture. My recommendation is to not dry this in the dryer - let this one dry flat. The material is very soft, this has become one of my favorite shirts.

This top fits well and is a nice soft material. My only complaint is the color. It is much lighter / pastel than pictured. I love the medium vibrant purple as pictured. What I received is a light / soft lilac color. It still like it, and will keep it, but would have preferred that it was colored as pictured.

Seem to run a tad large.. i bought my size (9) and the "slop" a little. Don't expect these to be walking around the market  (flea or grocery) shoes.. i wear my strictly on "holidays".. July 4th cookout, Memorial Day picnic, Labor Day gathering, etc... Read about "Tom's" online & see why you should buy from them.. They donate shoes to people in poor countries. I get lots of compliments on these shoes!

Definitely not like my other toms. While I love the design. They fit way smaller than my others in the same size.  Still hoping they will strech some.  The insole is much thicker and is removable,  not sure if this is a new design or like others have said a fake. I Judy wish they wound have fit like all my other ones.  Definitely a disappoint
So comfortable!  True to size. Picture is showing the already a little beat up but I literally wear them to run errands, work he yard, you name it.

I am somewhat of a shoe "snob" and definitely prefer TOMS brand shoes. Their brand is consistently comfortable and fits as expected (only because I know how to order them)... This being said, please note that TOMS shoes *usually* stretch a bit after a few wears. After purchasing my first pair a few years ago (the same size I wear with all other shoes), I learned this the hard way. I now order my TOMS a half-size (or full-size, if half is not available) smaller than my typical shoe size. After the first day, they stretch to the "right" size and fit comfortably from then on. I've received many compliments from these shoes too and would recommend these gems to anyone! :)

I’ve had these for a couple months now and the foam is already breaking down and separating from the shoe. The canvas the shoe is made of is great and stands up to daily wear. If only the sole would hold of adequately. These are definitely not well enough made for daily use.
Material will cause blisters. I thought I could break these in, but the fabric is way too unforgiving.

I got the black and white tile print Toms as well as a pair in dark pink. They're both real Toms and fit just like all my other pairs do. What I didn't realize was that the black and white pair is vegan so they have this squishy sort of insert in them rather than the leather that is usually there, which is fine by me but the issue is that the vegan insole comes out when I take the shoes off so that's pretty annoying but after looking on the Toms website I learned that it's supposed to be removable. It's a small annoyance of an otherwise great pair of shoes. The pink ones looks more on the red side but I knew that when I got them

Love my Toms! They do run a little small (I had to go up a size than what I usually wear), but I think it’s just because of the material and shape. The toe box is a little tight at first, but stretches out with use and gets more comfortable. They are my go to shoes when going out and about; I love that they are fast and easy to slip on and I don’t have to tie anything. Recommended!

I have funky, small feet (6.5) and my right foot is slightly wider than my left. It was a pretty rock solid shoe at first but wear it around the house for a day and they’re pretty comfy! I’m a fan, but be leary cause I know Toms does not work for everyone. Be careful with the pinky toes wide-feet peeps!

I have been buying the same exact shoes for a few years, and decided to buy this pair of TOMS Del Rey shoes from this seller this time. I normally buy them from Journeys shoe store. Long story short, these shoes are tagged incorrectly with “made in Vietnam”. TOMS are made in a number of different countries but Vietnam is not one of them. The blue patch on the back of the shoes were also crooked. Real TOMS are centered with clean stitching. I know that the pair I got were counterfeit TOMS and they were very uncomfortable and tore up the heel of my foot. I returned these shoes to this amazon seller and purchased a REAL pair on the Journeys website. I am very disappointed.

OK, folks, I don't often leave product reviews, but the moment these amazing sandals/flip-flops were placed upon my feet, I swear I could hear my little tootsies SING!  I have plantar fasciitis, and so I need supportive, cushy footwear. My feet are also a bit on the chubby side, so I can't wear "normal" sandals because they are always too tight...which means I normally just have to settle for flip flops, which are not always the perfect match for the outfit and situation that I am in.These sandals are perfect! They look dressy enough to wear with a nice summery dress out to dinner, and yet not so stuffy that I couldn't throw on a pair of short and a t-shirt and head out to the park.  They are a DREAM to walk in!!! The "strap" material is stretchy enough to accommodate moving around and walking, and yet supportive enough to feel like these shoes won't fall off. They do give a very slight tug back into place, if that makes sense. The cushion is perfectly squishy without being too squishy - just enough squish for my plantar fasciitis to be happy walking in these all day. No, seriously...ALL DAY.I am currently wondering what is the appropriate amount of time to wait before I tell my husband that I'm buying several more pair in other colors? Psssshaw, I'm going to just go ahead and do it!! You should, too!I normally wear a 9 1/2 to a 10, depending on the brand of shoe. I got these in a 10 and they fit me perfectly with a little room past my toes and behind my heel, but that's how I like it. Sometimes when I'm sitting or walking in just the right way, my feet always tend to shift in whatever shoes I am wearing, so I like a little room to move around.p.s. I hate it when people leave reviews saying they got their stuff for free or discounted (and, gosh, why aren't companies offering ME free stuff or discounts, eh?!)...so I'm happy to report that I am a REAL person who paid full price for these. Worth every penny!

I've been trying to avoid dropping $30 on a pair of flip flops but after searching tirelessly for something both cheap and comfortable with no luck, I finally broke down and got some yoga slings.  Ordered the same pattern in 2 different colors and absolutely love them!  I would prefer a little more arch support but overall they are very comfortable and super cute.I pretty consistently wear an 8.5 and after reading all of the reviews, I decided to order up and get a 9.  They seemed a bit big but I was leaving for the beach in just a few days, so I quickly ordered them in 8 and planned to return whichever didn't fit.  I snapped this photo of an 8 (back/left) and a 9 (front/right) in the hopes that it might help the other in-betweeners.  Maybe it's just because I have short toes but there was just too much extra space at the front for my liking.  The 8's fit great and the 9's were returned!

First off, if you're reading reviews of this product because you're considering purchasing a pair -- I can easily say just do it. These are great, comfy and adorable shoes.But I'm going to go against popular opinion here regarding going up or down for half-size people. I'm an 8.5 in everything -- boots, flats, pumps, trainers. Against my better judgement -- I followed the advice of other reviewers and went with a size down.When the shoes arrived I knew instantly that I loved them. However -- I had mixed feelings about the size. They fit -- but they *just* fit. When it comes to flip-flops I like a bit of overhand at the heel. Call it an OCD or whatever, but i like the shoe to extend ever-so-slightly from my heel.So I wrestled with what to do -- conquer my obsessive attitude and DEAL WITH IT or get a size 9.Not only did I buy a size 9 -- I bought two pairs in size 9.  AND they are PERFECT.I'm not returning the original size 8, either. I'm going to gift them to my sister who wears a 7.5 -- I just know she'll love these too.

I racked up a whopping 68 miles across six park days in Disney World wearing only these flip flops. My steps are often missed while I'm pushing the stroller so I'm sure there were even more miles than that. I always wear broken-in tennis shoes on big walking days and packed them with me just in case these flip flops didn't work out, but I never needed them! My feet normally get very hot and swell and I really hate wearing tennis shoes. I never wore these before our trip and was so happy there was no break in period at all. It even rained for hours on end one day and my feet were still comfortable in these. I just dried them with the hotel hairdryer that evening and wore them again the next day. The only time they were even the slightest bit uncomfortable was when my preschooler accidentally spilled orange juice on my feet and the piece between my toes got a tad sticky and rubbed. Fortunately it never caused a blister and once the fabric dried out, it was comfortable again. I would highly, highly, highly recommend these! These are going to be my forever disney, zoo day, travel, etc. shoes!! As for fit, I felt like these were a bit big. I usually wear a 7.5. I have pretty wide feet, so sometimes I need an 8 just because I need the width. I ordered an 8 in these since a half size wasn't available. The 8 felt fine enough to keep but if i order another pair, I believe I will go down to a 7.
I have 4 pair of Sanuk Yoga Slings. I love them that much!! I normally wear a 7 1/2 shoe and I took the advice to order a size 8 since they don't come in half sizes. Good advice!! They fit perfectly!

I love, love, love these! I was worried about how they'd look on my feet, I have chubby feet, but they feet like a glove. They are great. And oohh so comfortable! I originally bought them as beach shoes but, I'm not gonna lie, I'm gonna wear them all the time!
Wow! The design itself is beautiful! I'm very happy with this purchase. Very comfortable. I will buy more! ❤😎😎❤

Not an orthotic sandal, but sooo comfortable anyway, just don't look for arch support! Stay on don't slide or slip! I often buy a 9-1/ 2 in sandals and a 10 in shoes. I tried 9 and 10 and 10 are the better fit, not too long. If i n doubt i would go up the size. I saw these on Amazon just browsing and loved them. I bought for a cruise because nothing is worse than sore feet or a sandal that rubs into a blister. These will pack flat for suitcase room since I carry on to an airplane and will be good wherever so multi use is good! I love them and sooo cute. Just a great buy!.

I generally wear a 9.5. When a brand doesn't carry half sizes, I usually go up a size, but my last pair of Sanuks was a bit loose as a 10, so I went down to a 9 for these. The 9 is perfect me. I have really high arches, so I was a little worried that the strap over the top of the foot would be too tight, but they fit just fine - to give myself a bit more space I switched the layering of the straps from the way they are in the picture, so that the over-foot strap is underneath the ankle strap. The soles are super-comfy, and I don't think the toe piece will require the usual wearing-in period since the fabric is so soft. Another plus - the shoes came in a really neat sustainable draw-string bag.Update 3/21/14: I bought these days before a 2 week beach resort vacation. These shoes were amazing - I wore them to dinner, to the pool, on a walking tour . . . all over the place. No wearing-in time, no blisters, no sore feet. They do take an extra moment to put on (mostly to get the straps to lay right) but that moment is very worthwhile! I could have left my other shoes at home, they were that great. I've ordered these in two more colors.Update 1/23/15: I now have 4 pairs of these. I wore them all summer long last year and well into fall. They do eventually get a little smelly from constant wear. To combat this, I wash the foot bed with yoga mat spray, and hand wash the cloth part with mild detergent. The cloth also stretches out a little over time, but not enough to affect the fit (they get easier to put on, but still stay on well). The patterned ones seem to stretch less than the solids. I get compliments on them all the time. Love my Sanuks!

I saw someone in Vegas wearing a pair of Sanuk Yoga Slings and instantly fell in love with the style. When I bought mine, I was so excited! However, after wearing them for a couple of days I'm actually very disappointed.1. The sole is too narrow and my foot slips off when walking.2. Somehow the straps don't seem to hold the sandal to your foot so it feels as though it is flopping around your foot.Although very adorable, I would not recommend.

I have the blue, and the color is very pretty, better than I expected.  Based on the size chart I would be a L (5'6", 38B, 138 lbs)  but I did over one size larger, the XL, because I like mine roomy and  relaxed, and also just in case the rayon shrinks, which Rayon usually does, but not much at all in this case, thank goodness.  I wish there are hidden pockets, which make this dress perfect ... but otherwise a great easy piece to wear around the house or go out.  as to the chemical smell, there is a little bit of it, but I washed mine and use a nice fabric softener, so it is much better now, not bothersome at all.
So comfortable and flows nicely! Im 5'4, 165 and I purchased a medium and it fit me perfectly!!!!

Comfy, cute casual summer dress. This fit great! I’m 5’4”/200lbs and got the XL. It hits me just barely above the knee and looks great. The fabric is soft and not too heavy, which is perfect for August. The color is pretty much dead on to my iPhone or iPad screen. I got the Daybreak color.

I’m in love with this dress!! I ordered another one in a different color because I liked it so much. I’m 5’2”, 155lbs, 34DDD and the large fit great. I could’ve possibly went down to a medium (it’s roomy). I like the fit though for my chest area. The material is pretty thin, but I love that for the summer. I think it’ll be cute with leggings for the winter. Great buy!

LOVE THIS DRESS! I was worried about the material maybe showing every little lump and bump, but this is great! Its flowy and not super fitted, yet still gives a good shape. The quality is comparable to that of piko clothing. The color was a little more brown than I expected, but its not like a dark brown. It still works for me. The length comes right about my knee cap, similar to the look that you see in the model. I am 5'5, 155lb, athletic build, and I purchased a medium.I am currently stocking up on some fall clothes and I plan to buy more things from this company! I was thinking about maybe even getting more of these in a different color or in long sleeve.

I have a lot of dresses with this same material so I knew that would not be a problem. It was the style I was concerned about....but to my surprise I love this dress. I am 5'2" 198 pounds and this dress fits my curves well on top and flairs at just the right spot for the lower half. I am planning to buy another color!!

This dress runs pretty true to size and it's well made. I wear it to hack around on the weekends or on a very casual work day in the summer. It launders great...didn't shrink or fade at all. I liked it so much I ordered it in several other colors!  Highly recommended:-)

This rating is based on the fact that the dress cost $18...  Well worth the money!  Super comfortable, but you can dress it up easily, too.  I am 5'7" / 145 lbs. - M fit perfectly.  4 stars because it comes with a strong odor.  Make sure to order with enough time to let the dress air out before you wear it.

I love this little dress. Even though its source is China, an XL fit me. (I usually wear L to XL, whichever fits.)  I read the reviews, ordered the XL, and hoped for the best. And my two Levaca styles fit me nicely, even lengthwise. I thought I would like the flowing, draping style of the other garment better but I love this one as well:  simple on top with tiered gathers on the skirt. I like the simple ease of this dress. I am 5'4", and "the new forty". Was looking for something cool and casual but nice-looking to wear at home and around town this summer, with leggings, or without. The fabric on both items feels wonderful; smooth and feather-light. The construction seems well engineered, although the waist on this garment wants to place itself a bit too high on me. (Busty women might find the waist crosses the bustline.) The waist is easily adjusted to only slightly high, but short of empire, and it doesn't bother me. I ordered the dark blue, which is purple.  The darker fabric doesn't draw attention to the waist, and will be lovely with brighter accessories for summer.

I ordered the khaki color wanting a neutral for summer in size medium.  For reference, I am 5’3 and 130 pounds.  The dress is adorable!  A smidge tight in the bust area but with a good bra it’s fine.  I am not large busted, if you are, I would HIGHLY recommend sizing up.  The length is perfect, the tiers are cute and it’s not too boxy.  Looks great with flats or dress up a bit with a heel and some long necklaces.  The color is more of a cocoa than khaki.  Overall very pleased and what a great buy, looks much more expensive on.

This is a good, high quality, casual shirt. The fabric is soft and feels well made. I purchased the Apricot color. It is more of a warm, soft, golden yellow than it appears in the photo. It is a beautiful color. The fabric is a bit thin, and see-theough, so I need to wear a camisole under. I wish it were thicker, but that is my only complaint.

I purchased this because I have been looking for tops that have REAL fabric in them.  Most women's tops have polyester, nylon, rayon, acrylic, spanx and other names the industry have created to call fabric that's not fabric.  These are petroleum-based manufactured fibers.  This top is not 100% petroleum but it, in my research of looking for ones with more real fabric this worked.  It's 97%cotton, 3%spandex but that 3% gives the top a lot of stretch.Another reason I purchased this is I was looking for a top that breathed.  The fake fabric tops don't allow the skin to breath and hold in body heat.  Not a god thing if you a warm bodied person or for women experiencing hot flushes of flashes.  I wore this shirt for the first time yesterday and it was comfortable.  I didn't get overheated or feel like the fabric was sticking to my skin.  However it is still cold here so I'll have to wait and see.  The top is plenty stretchy with jut 3% spanex.  Things I like about the top:Pros:The color:  The colors are vibrant and clear, not muted.The Cut:  The cut is tapered, not hanging like a tent like many of today's top.Less Spanx: This allows the top to be more relaxed and not fit like a second skin.The Cut: The scoop neck is not too revealing.The Cut: I like the length.  On me it's tunic length because I ordered the x-large.The Cut: Sleeve cut is nice.Cons:The Spanx:  Even though it's only 3% it could easily be less and have the same wearing experience.Fabric: It fits well but once the fabric settles it relaxes and become larger-that's because of the cotton which has a tendency to stretch out.The Fit: True to size?  What does that mean anymore?  There is a standardized size chart on most websites but there is no consistency in fit. I have ordered from Amazon clothes according to the size charts only to send them back because they didn't fit for one reason or another.  IMHO true to size means how do you want it to fit?  When I order more of this top I will order the large, but only because if I go smaller I'll lose the length I like.I would recommend this top.

This fit great and form fitting.  I usually wear a large but ordered a extra large because of my DD cups.  The shirt stops right below the buttocks and I have a small waist with nice size hips.  I will definitely be ordering this shirt in other colors.

I'm 5'11" with very broad shoulders and a long torso. I recently had a baby and ordered an XL to fit my shoulders and be sightly loose over my midsection. I can also easily nurse in this shirt if that matters to anyone. This shirt is amazing! I've never loved a T-shirt this much. It's so soft and it's long, which is hard for me to find. I love this. I'm going to buy more for sure.

I really like these blouses.  They are lightweight and nice looking.  The colors are very pretty too.  I like that the shirts are long, which is nice for people who want to detract attention from their mid-section.  I especially like the scoop neck.  I find that most T-shirts come up too high and if you are large-busted, they will just make you look fat.  The scoop neck on these pulls away from the neckline enough that it creates a really nice shape and hags well on the body.The only reason I did not give these 5 stars is because the material is so light and delicate that I would recommend hand washing and hanging to dry rather than running them through a machine if you really want them to last.  On the other hand, the shirts are very inexpensive, so replacing them may not be an issue for you.  I definitely recommend.

The first one I ordered was red in xxl.  I usually get xxl in tees because I have natural 36DDs and don't always want to have guys staring, especially at work which is where I intend to wear these.  However, the xxl was very boxy.  Pretty color, but ⬛.  So I figured I'd go down a size even though the difference between the xl and xxl is bigger than the difference between any of the other sizes, a 9" difference versus a 3" difference.  Thankfully, the xl, this time in burgundy, fits ok, not too tight in the chest so I won't feel self-conscious at work.  The red is a very vibrant and bold shade, while the burgundy has depth and warmth.  The material is soft but has weight, not that thin tissue paper-like material, and in those colors is not see-thru.  The seams are even and trim.  The shirts do come out of the dryer a little wrinkled, but that may be because I dry my clothes on "no heat" so they last longer.  Hanging them on hangers helps get rid of some of the wrinkles but if you fold your tees, you'll likely have a very wrinkled shirt.I intend to get more in the burgundy (for work) and some of the other colors (just cuz), in xl.

I'm very casual and have been replacing shirts with more simple tops as my older ones have worn out. I ordered 2 of these and loved the fit so much that I ordered more. The top is form-fitting but still flattering on me. The top goes down to the top of my thigh (I am 5'5, 178 lbs and an hourglass shape). I probably could have gone a size down to a Large, but wasn't sure if it would end up too tight across my D-cups.  The shirt is easy to dress up or down depending on the occasion. Have and would repurchase!
super comfy!  Nice & long.  will purchase again & think I need a L vs XL.  I am 5'1" & 140lbs

These are a great fit. They don't cling in the underarm area and are not skin tight. I am 5'4", 170 pounds (37ish inch waist, for reference), and I ordered the large. Not tight, and not super flow-y. I would say I am a large size in most tank tops/t-shirts, so definitely order the size that you would usually get unless you want it especially tight/loose. The colors are great and I saw no loose threads upon taking them out of the package.

First off, if you are a person of average arm length, ignore the rest of this review and just know that this is a really nice, basic shirt.  The quality is good, the sizing seems normal, and the fabric is a nice weight and feel that looks like it should hold up to long-term wear really well.Okay, are they gone?  Right, the rest of this review is for those folks out there who, like me, have monkey arms and are constantly on quest for long enough sleeves.  Folks, I'm sad to say that this shirt is not the answer you are looking for.It seemed promising at first.  I have a long torso as well as long arms, and when I pulled the shirt on, not only did the fitted waist area actually fall at my waist (as opposed to somewhere around my ribcage as so often happens) but the hem hits right at the widest part of my hips, so I could bend and sit in this without any unwanted exposure.  Nice!  But alas!  When I tugged the sleeves down, they hit an inch above my wrist; after a bit of wear, I found that their natural ride-up position had them falling a full two inches short of my wrist.So if you are long in the arm and torso, I'd definitely consider the short-sleeved version of this shirt, but skip the long-sleeve version.

This is my favorite style of Columbia shirt! I have it in white and clear blue, and can't wait to buy more. The colors are fantastic, and the fit is tailored nicely for females. The snap buttons make it a quick shirt to throw on, and super simple to roll or unroll the sleeves. The shirt itself is super thin and keeps you cool, while also providing excellent sun protection. I always wear one when kayaking, fishing, crabbing, etc. and never get sun burned. For size reference, I bought an XS and am 5'5" and 120 lbs. The XS isn't too snug, and allows me extra room to move my arms around comfortably. In the picture, I'm wearing the XS white shirt. My friend is a couple inches taller and is wearing a S in cool blue. If you want a good looking, cool, sun protectant shirt, this is definitely worth a purchase.

I ordered this shirt but ended up returning it for a few reasons. 1) There are no buttons, only white plastic snaps. To me this cheapens the look. I worry about the white plastic yellowing over time or the shirt popping open on me. 2) I ordered white because I thought it would look really fresh and cool. While I liked white, it was extremely sheer in the parts not lined with mesh. The lower back especially would show any tattoo, mole, bandaid etc. I think if you wore it really roomy, that would be okay but I was looking for a more fitted look.

Was lost in the woods for 12 hours in this shirt. Had to slide down a mountain in it. The evidence of my slide has not completely washed out of the back, only negative. I started out with it snapped up, sleeves down and ended up with it unsnapped, sleeves up. After hiking for 12 hours in it with few stops I had no chaffed areas. If fits close like a hiking shirt should. I'm a bit hippy so things from North Face in a 12 were too slim. The woman in the store told me I needed to look at Columbia so I came home and looked on Amazon. I leave the bottom snap unsnapped just because I don't like things too snug. I'm going to hike to the bottom of the  Grand Canyon in a few days and I will not take another shirt. I'll rinse this one out that night and wear it back out the next day. It dries quickly and I washed it in the washing machine and dried it on a hanger. The stain on the back is proof that I can survive in the deep woods. I will be 69 on June 3rd.
True to size, very thin, not too hot (I live in nm and it was 98 with no wind yesterday). Great shirt will be buying more. I have a Large chest 38DD, and the XL does not have the dreaded button Gap

I have some Columbia Bahama button up shirts & wear a medium in those (I'm 5;7" 165 lbs), which may run slightly large, but in this shirt I get a large and it fits perfectly, very flattering fit and I still have some room to move. Love the yellow color, bright and vibrant, but if you don't like flashy colors you'll feel like you're wearing a banana Laffy Taffy wrapper.I am a biological technician doing field work. Between the Tamiami and the Bahama, the Tamiama is more lightweight, which is nice if it's hot out, but snags more easily and therefore doesn't hold up well if you're doing daily field work in shrubby areas.

It is very cute, but the Medium fit me like a Large.  I then ordered it in SM, arrived just now, and it's perfect! Still plenty of room to cross arms, since the back ventilation "shawl" is roomy--it does come down farther than most shirts like this, but seems more stylish.Big plus: FINALLY a roll-up sleeve that covers more like a 3/4 sleeve (for the M, just below the elbow for the S).  Most hit above elbow and are NOT flattering!The "fossil" color is sort of like the old Necco chocolate flavor wafer candy.  Will not show dirt much.The "button-down collar" uses velcro so tips can be easily opened to lay spread out.There are TWO zippered pockets near the waist.  These will be fabulous for travel.  (PS I threw away one shirt--another brand--that had chest pockets.  Unusable because they make you look lumpy, VERY unflattering, and if you tried to unbutton some top buttons, the mesh lining hung out like bad underwear.)AND the "Columbia" tag is velcro-ed so that it could hold a water tube or lip-balm.  LOVE this shirt!

Polyester ripstop is my favorite material for shirts.  I have so many varieties of this style across several brands.  The material keeps you cool in the summer and warm in the winter.  The material is soft, washes well, retains its color and doesn't wrinkle.  You can wear this shirt to the office and then step on a hiking trail after work without changing.  The sleeves fit well both rolled up or unraveled. A mesh flap in the back provides for ventilation.  These make great travel shirts because of the low maintenance.  Wash and ring them out and they dry out in a few hours.There are two side pockets above the hips for perhaps small wallet or phone or keys.  The pockets are a bit out of the way so as to not create bulk across the chest.I picked the vibrant rose red and will soon get other colors.  I noticed a large difference in price between the colors.

This was my second columbia shirt that I purchased from amazon the first being a different material...https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0089FB73W/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1I LOVE this shirt. The material is super soft and fast drying. I order the medium in the other style and it fit really big. The small fits perfect! I am 5'6" and around 135lbs I would recommend the small vs. medium.
Bright, lightweight. Fits perfectly. All as described. Washes well. Took it on a boat trip to the Caribbean. Will definitely buy more.

I adore these cool, trim-looking shirts.  I own at least seven and am rarely out of them in the summer.  I've even slept in them on train trips and when camping.  The black is a dark, saturated color -- subtle and flattering.  Here are a few notes or quibbles about these buttery, light-as-air shirts.*I wish the brand tag wasn't so obtrusive, or better yet, not visible.  I feel the tag stands out the worst against these black shirts.  If this top wasn't branded, I would also make them my office uniform in a heart beat.  As is, I sometimes wear under cardigans, but the sweater has to be heavy enough that the tag on front doesn't show through.  I've toyed with the idea of removing it using a seam ripper, but haven't been brave enough (or found a cheap enough shirt) to risk trying it yet.  I'm not sure the fine (though durable) material would withstand the removal without showing holes/pricks.*I adore the snap buttons.  The fact that they match the shirt is part of what makes the shirt so trim/streamlined IMO.  I wish that I had discovered these shirts (assuming they existed then) when I was nursing my kids.  However, I would caution those purchasing for this use that the snaps come open VERY easily.  Handy when sporting an infant in one arm and un-buttoning with another, but probably not ideal when nursing older babies or toddlers who like to tug clothing while they sup.  A firm grab in the right spot can tear the shirt right open.  However, if paired with enough confidence or a nursing cami, these would be a great toddler/older baby nursing option as well.*I wish that the length was longer, verging into CYA territory.  Please, please, please.  I in insist that my front and rear are comfortably covered when wearing with leggings/athletic tights, so making these shirts longer would allow me to wear them with all types of bottoms.*Strangely, I need a M in the sleeveless version and a L in the short and long-sleeved versions.  No idea why, but I know it's not just me because I've seen other reviews reflecting this difference.  I normally wear a M or S.*As a bonus, the back vent camouflages bra lines and bulges.
I am 5’ 6”, 135lbs, 34C. I ordered A small and it fits perfect. It’s a lose fit so the top is very forgiving. The material is soft and very good material. I would recommend.

I love this shirt! The color is so pretty and the material feels fantastic. I originally ordered this shirt larger than recommended on the sizing chart and was so sad when I had to send it back because it was way too big (lesson learned, this chart is definitely accurate). I have gotten quite a few compliments already. I did wash it on cold before wearing and it did not shrink or lose any of it's pretty color. It was line dried so I can't say if it would shrink in the dryer. I'm so glad I re-ordered and am sure this shirt will get plenty of wear.

I spent ages trying to find a great plus-sized cotton shirt. I live in the South where humidity will ruin your day and your cloths need to breathe! Anyway, this shirt is so flattering! I have a large chest (40/E), and the 2x has plenty of room. Literally the first thing I said when I tried it on was "this is so comfy!" It's super cute too.

This top is absolutely adorable! Also, it is made of a nicer material than I expected. In fact, it’s made out of the exact material that you would expect a shirt like this to be made… But with the good price, you never know what you’re going to get LOL… So I was very pleasantly surprised. It has some stretch to it, so don’t worry if you have larger arms or anything like that. It is also true to size; I am 5 foot six, slim, with a pretty large chest of about 36D, and medium fit me PERFECTLY. It was fitting around the chest, and flowy as you go down, just as a shirt like this is meant to be. I got nonstop compliments on the shirt, and several people ask me where they could buy it, even my 28-year-old daughter asked to borrow it ha ha! Really, this top is cute and stylish for any age, and I honestly think it would be flattering on pretty much any body type. If you’re considering it, definitely buy this!

Great, functional white cotton tea with the cold shoulder accent to play it up a little! Nice, quality material. I'm almost 5'1 and 110 pounds. I bought the size small and it fits great. Would buy again.

Height: 5’5”Bust: 38”Waist: 30”Bought Size SMALLPics are taken as soon as I took the shirt out of the box so it has NOT been washed yet.If anything about the shirt changes after being washed, I will do a follow up review(I wash my clothes on delicate, cold, and line dry)The shirt is a very nice material. Soft, a little stretchy, not too thin, & very flowy. It is a little big, especially for a small, but I expected that.It’s slightly see-through, but not bad for being a white shirt.Definitely a sweet buy and glad I took a chance on Amazon

I am 5' 3" at about 130/135lbs.  I purchased the Blue in a large and it fit exactly as I wanted it too. Not clingy/Not baggy & not down to my knees (which is something I struggle with).  The material is soft and not super thin either.  I can't wait for spring so I can start wearing the top.

This top is just what I needed! We were doing an enormous family portrait in red, white,and blue, and I wanted something a little different. The "cold shoulder" holes are very unique and fit just right. (I ordered up to be safe the first time, and thank goodness for free returns, because I was able to return it and get another one in the size I usually wear which worked perfectly.) The material is thin but not see-through. Machine wash and dry worked just fine, but I have only done it once so far. Not sure how it will hold up over time.

Nice shirt, very flattering, but it does seem to run a little large and is bigger at the bottom so it fits loosely. I got a medium but it fit me in width more like a size large would, the length was more like a medium. If it was a bit more fitted it would look better and I would give it 5 stars. It is 95% cotton so if it goes in the dryer it will probably shrink, I air dried mine because I don't want it to get shorter.
Very nice top. Material flattering and hangs good. Size is true. This top can be dressed up or down. Would recommend.

Very happy!!!  I was worried about getting this shirt in the white floral because most white T-shirts are see-through.  This is a very nice material  and I am able to wear it without a tank top under my shirt!  Huge bonus!!!
Super cute and seems well made. I’m 5’7” / 190 lbs  and I bought the XL

I get compliments on this shirt every time I wear it. It fits well, washes easily, doesn’t seem to shrink, the colors are fantastic— only good things! This is a looser fitting shirt, but I love the fit. Fits as expected based on the product images.
